title: Has the National Broadcasting Authority opposed the re-authorization of the Violence Against Women Act in April 2019?
subtitle: While the Arms Rights Group states that it supports the main thrust of the Violence against Women Act, it opposes amendments that lower the criminal threshold to prevent a person from buying a weapon.
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: In April 2019, when the United States House of Representatives voted to re-authorize the Violence Against Women Act, the National Reform Agency opposed this procedure because of the addition of amendments that would lower the criminal threshold required to prevent a person from buying a weapon.
